net.kuujo.vertigo.cluster

Interface Group


  • public interface Group
    Client for communicating with cluster groups.

    This client handles deployment of modules and verticles within a group of nodes in a Vertigo cluster.

    A single Vertigo cluster can be split into deployment groups. Groups allow users to specify groups of nodes on which a given module or verticle can be deployed. This is an interface for operating on a single group within a specific cluster. Deployments made to the group are guaranteed to be deployed only on nodes within the group.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • address

        String address()
        Returns the group address.
        Returns:
        The group address.

      • registerJoinHandler

        Group registerJoinHandler(Handler<Node> handler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node joins the group.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes joining the group by registering a handler at {cluster}.{group}.join. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that joined the group.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node joins the group.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • registerJoinHandler

        Group registerJoinHandler(Handler<Node> handler,
                        Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node joins the group.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes joining the group by registering a handler at {cluster}.{group}.join. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that joined the group.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node joins the group.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the handler has been registered.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • unregisterJoinHandler

        Group unregisterJoinHandler(Handler<Node> handler)
        Unregisters a node join handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler to unregister.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • unregisterJoinHandler

        Group unregisterJoinHandler(Handler<Node> handler,
                          Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Unregisters a node join handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler to unregister.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the handle has been unregistered.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • registerLeaveHandler

        Group registerLeaveHandler(Handler<Node> handler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node leaves the group.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes leaving the group by registering a handler at {cluster}.{group}.leave. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that left the group.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node leaves the group.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • registerLeaveHandler

        Group registerLeaveHandler(Handler<Node> handler,
                         Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node leaves the group.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes leaving the group by registering a handler at {cluster}.{group}.leave. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that left the group.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node leaves the group.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the handler has been registered.
        Returns:
        The group.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The group.

      • ping

        Group ping(Handler<AsyncResult<Group>> resultHandler)
        Pings the group.
        Parameters:
        resultHandler - A handler to be called once the group responds.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • getNode

        Group getNode(String address,
            Handler<AsyncResult<Node>> resultHandler)
        Gets a node in the group.
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the node.
        resultHandler - A handler to be called with the result. If the node does not exist then a ClusterException will occur.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • getNodes

        Group getNodes(Handler<AsyncResult<Collection<Node>>> resultHandler)
        Gets a collection of nodes in the group.
        Parameters:
        resultHandler - A handler to be called once the nodes are loaded.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • selectNode

        Group selectNode(Object key,
               Handler<AsyncResult<Node>> resultHandler)
        Selects a node in the group according to the given key.

        The group guarantees that the same node will always be selected given the same key so long as the node exists in the group. Once the node leaves the group a new node will be selected.

        Parameters:
        key - The key from which to select the group.
        resultHandler - A handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • installModule

        Group installModule(String moduleName)
        Installs a local module to all nodes in the group.

        The module being installed must be available on the local classpath in the normal Vert.x mods directory. If the module is already installed on a given node then the node will be skipped, otherwise the local module will be zipped, uploaded, and installed to the node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to install.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • installModule

        Group installModule(String moduleName,
                  Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Installs a local module to all nodes in the group.

        The module being installed must be available on the local classpath in the normal Vert.x mods directory. If the module is already installed on a given node then the node will be skipped, otherwise the local module will be zipped, uploaded, and installed to the node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to install.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the module has been installed.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • uninstallModule

        Group uninstallModule(String moduleName)
        Uninstalls a module from all nodes in the group.

        When the module is uninstalled, it will be removed from the classpath of the remote node. This means you should not uninstall modules that were originally installed on any given node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to uninstall.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • uninstallModule

        Group uninstallModule(String moduleName,
                    Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Uninstalls a module from all nodes in the group.

        When the module is uninstalled, it will be removed from the classpath of the remote node. This means you should not uninstall modules that were originally installed on any given node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to uninstall.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the module has been uninstalled.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployModule

        Group deployModule(String moduleName)
        Deploys a module to the group.

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the group. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployModule

        Group deployModule(String moduleName,
                 JsonObject config)
        Deploys a module to the group.

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the group. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        config - The module configuration.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployModule

                 int instances)

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the group. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        instances - The number of instances to deploy.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployModule

        Group deployModule(String moduleName,
                 Handler<AsyncResult<String>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a module to the group.

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the group. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the module has been deployed. The handler will be called with the unique deployment ID if successful.
        Returns:
        The group.

        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployVerticle

        Group deployVerticle(String main)
        Deploys a verticle to the group.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployVerticle

        Group deployVerticle(String main,
                   JsonObject config)
        Deploys a verticle to the group.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        config - The verticle configuration.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • deployVerticle

        Group deployWorkerVerticle(String main,
                         JsonObject config,
                         int instances,
                         boolean multiThreaded)
        Deploys a worker verticle to the group.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        config - The verticle configuration.
        instances - The number of instances to deploy.
        multiThreaded - Indicates whether the worker should be multi-threaded.
        Returns:
        The group.

                         JsonObject config,
                         int instances,
                         boolean multiThreaded,
                         Handler<AsyncResult<String>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a worker verticle to the group.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the verticle has been deployed. The handler will be called with the unique deployment ID if successful.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • undeployModule

        Group undeployModule(String deploymentID)
        Undeploys a module from the group.

        Given the unique module deployment ID, Vertigo will ensure that the deployment is undeployed from the appropriate node in the group.

        Parameters:
        deploymentID - The deployment ID of the module to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • undeployModule

        Group undeployModule(String deploymentID,
                   Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a module from the group.

        Given the unique module deployment ID, Vertigo will ensure that the deployment is undeployed from the appropriate node in the group.

        Parameters:
        deploymentID - The deployment ID of the module to undeploy.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • undeployVerticle

        Group undeployVerticle(String deploymentID)
        Undeploys a verticle from the group.

        Given the unique verticle deployment ID, Vertigo will ensure that the deployment is undeployed from the appropriate node in the group.

        Parameters:
        deploymentID - The deployment ID of the verticle to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The group.

      • undeployVerticle

        Group undeployVerticle(String deploymentID,
                     Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a verticle from the group.

        Given the unique verticle deployment ID, Vertigo will ensure that the deployment is undeployed from the appropriate node in the group.

        Parameters:
        deploymentID - The deployment ID of the verticle to undeploy.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The group.
